what: Remove batch effect of RNA-seq data — batch_combat
title: Remove batch effect of RNA-seq data — batch_combat
text: Remove batch effect RNA-seq data combat

title: Remove batch effect of RNA-seq data — batch_combat
code: batch_combat(   expressionMatrix,   batch,   covariate = NULL,   par.prior = TRUE,   prior.plots = FALSE,   ... )

title: Remove batch effect of RNA-seq data — batch_combat
text: expressionMatrix Genomic measure matrix (dimensions probe x sample) - example, expression matrix. better use log transformed data input, must negative value data, generate NaN value. batch Batch covariate (one batch allowed) covariate data frame contain covariates instead . column must factor sample order data. example, batch different experimental platforms removed differences normal cancer calculated, normal CANCER samples experiment variables interested, data generally variables interested subsequent research. batch correction, need consider difference quantity distribution batch (unbalanced) par.prior (Optional) TRUE indicates parametric adjustments used, FALSE indicates non-parametric adjustments used prior.plots (Optional) TRUE give prior plots black kernel estimate empirical batch effect density red parametric ... arguments ComBat

title: Remove batch effect of RNA-seq data — batch_combat
text: data probe x sample genomic measure matrix, adjusted batch effects.

title: Remove batch effect of RNA-seq data — batch_combat
text: result Combat contain negative values, replace zero

title: Remove batch effect of RNA-seq data — batch_combat
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  library(bladderbatch) data(bladderdata) pheno = pData(bladderEset) expressionMatrix = exprs(bladderEset) batch = pheno$batch covariate = data.frame(cancer = as.factor(pheno$cancer)) correctMatrix <- FunctionCombat(expressionMatrix, batch, covariate = covariate)  } # }

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   counts = do.call(cbind, tapply(seur@data.info$orig.ident, seur@ident, table))   covariates = data.frame(condition=gsub('[12].*', '', rownames(counts)))   res = dirichlet_regression(counts, covariates, counts ~ condition) } # }

what: Impute the NA value in matrix — fill_by_constant
title: Impute the NA value in matrix — fill_by_constant
text: Impute NA value matrix different method

title: Impute the NA value in matrix — fill_by_constant
code: fill_by_constant(   mat,   method = c("median", "mean", "min", "max"),   MARGIN = c("row", "column"),   contant_value = NULL )

title: Impute the NA value in matrix — fill_by_constant
text: mat matrix object method method used fill NA value. Can median: Use row column median value fill NA mean: Use row column mean value fill NA min: Use global min value fill NA max: Use global max value fill NA MARGIN choose direction two get mean median value fill NA. useful method mean median contant_value contant value fill NA. Default NULL. set argument, NA value matrix fill

title: Impute the NA value in matrix — fill_by_constant
text: return matrix fill NA

title: Impute the NA value in matrix — fill_by_constant
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  a <- matrix(c(1:5, NA), ncol = 2)  fill_by_constant(mat = a)  fill_by_constant(mat = a, contant_value = 1)  } # }

title: Prism themes — prism_theme
code: prism_theme(   base_family = "sans",   base_size = 14,   base_fontface = "bold",   base_line_size = base_size/14,   base_rect_size = base_size/14,   axis_text_angle = 0,   border = FALSE )

title: Prism themes — prism_theme
text: base_family string. Base font family, default "sans". base_size numeric. Base font size, given "pt". base_fontface string. Base font face, default "bold". base_line_size numeric. Base linewidth line elements base_rect_size numeric. Base linewidth rect elements axis_text_angle integer. Angle axis text degrees. One : 0, 45, 90, 270. border logical. border drawn around plot? Clipping occur unless e.g. coord_cartesian(clip = "") used.

title: Prism themes — prism_theme
text: Returns list-like object class theme.
